en-US.alert_about: Location triggers that works with Autocuts to automatically run shortcuts in the background based on your location while you use your iOS device.
en-US.alert_get_location: Retrieving your current location. This may take a few moments.
en-US.alert_new_shortcut: You must select a shortcut to continue.
en-US.alert_update_none: You are running the latest version of Autocuts Location Trigger.
en-US.error_locationTriggers_none: You have no location triggers. Tap New… from the Home screen to create one.
en-US.error_timeRange: The end date is before the start date.
en-US.prompt_delete: Delete this location trigger? This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_delete_multiple: Delete these location triggers? This operation cannot be undone.
en-US.prompt_device_custom:
Enter the name of the iOS device on which this Autocut will run.

You can find the device name in Settings > General > About > Name
en-US.prompt_limitkit_interval: For each location trigger, enter the number of minutes to wait between location checks.
en-US.prompt_new_device: Run this location trigger on this device, all devices, or a specific device?
en-US.prompt_new_input_askShortcut: Autocuts will call the shortcut with "Autocuts Custom Input". The shortcut must be able to display custom UI for providing input for this Autocut.
en-US.prompt_new_location:
Enter location.

Leave blank to use your current location.
en-US.prompt_new_onSuccess: What should happen to the location trigger after a successful match?
en-US.prompt_new_tags: Enter tags to organize your location triggers. Separate each tag with a new line.
en-US.prompt_new_time: Select the time your location trigger will be evaluated:
en-US.prompt_new_type:
Create a new Autocuts location trigger that will automatically run a shortcut when you arrive or leave a location.

Don't forget to have Autocuts set to run as an Open App Personal Automation.
en-US.prompt_settings_radius: Enter the default trigger radius in {{unit}}:
